C.Choice: The workers were weak because their diet mainly consisted of dried fish and fruit.

D.Choice: The terrain was steep and the workers had to dig tunnels through mountains.

Content: Which of the following statements reflects the ğ— ğ—”ğ—œğ—¡ idea of Passage 2?

A.Choice: Chinese workers were needed to help build railroads because the Central Pacific Railroad Company had only 600 workers in 1864 and needed over 5,000.

B.Choice: Chinese workers faced a range of dangers while building railroads, including the explosives used to blast tunnels and exposure to freezing cold in winter.

C.Choice: Chinese workers worked for low pay under terrible conditions and should be honored for making a valuable contribution to the development of the United States.

D.Choice: Chinese workers used a variety of clever techniques, such as lowering themselves in baskets over steep embankments, to get to places they could not otherwise have reached.

SubTopics: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.
Content: Now read the writing task and draft a response. As you write, think about what makes writing successful.
problems/NMG7E/media/33a.jpg

:box:You have read two passages about Chaco Culture National Historical Park. The two passages include information about what visitors to the park might see, experience, and learn during a visit to the park. Think about what makes Chaco Culture National Historical Park a place worth visiting.

Write an article that could be printed in your school newspaper to inform readers what makes Chaco Culture National Historical Park a good place for visitors to go on an overnight camping trip. Use details and examples from what you read, along with your own ideas and experience, to support your explanation.

:ibox:Today you will be writing an informative text. When you write to inform, you

â€¢ share what you know about a topic or subject with another person.
â€¢ think about what the audience may already know or may want to learn about the topic or subject.
â€¢ put your information in a logical order.
â€¢ use examples, definitions, and specific details to make the information clear and interesting to your audience.

After you have read the passages, and before you begin writing, think about

â€¢ what you already know about what might make a camping trip fun and interesting.
 â€¢ why Chaco Culture National Historical Park would be a good place for a camping trip.
â€¢ important things you learned by reading the passages.

Now write your response in the space provided.
